summary: The Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA) course is the original course from Cisco, offered as part of the Cisco IT Academy program. It is hosted by Bar-Ilan University's School of High-Tech and Cyber. The course provides comprehensive training in networking, including topics such as network components, topology architectures, IPv4 and IPv6 addressing, VLANs, interswitch connectivity, Layer 2 and Layer 3 protocols, NAT, NTP, DHCP, SSH, and security concepts. The course is hybrid, allowing participants to attend either on-campus at Bar-Ilan University in Ramat Gan or via Zoom. It spans 17 sessions over 85 academic hours, with classes held on Tuesdays from 17:30 to 21:30 and Fridays from 09:00 to 13:00. The course begins on January 3, 2025. Participants will gain sought-after IT certification and practical skills in network configuration, verification, and security.
full_text:
COURSE NAME: Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA)

COURSE OVERVIEW: This is the original Cisco course, part of the Cisco IT Academy program, offered by the School of High-Tech and Cyber at Bar-Ilan University. The course is designed to provide participants with the sought-after IT certification in the field of networking.

COURSE LEADERSHIP: The course is part of the Bar-Ilan University IT Academy program, under the School of High-Tech and Cyber.

CERTIFICATIONS: Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA)

COURSE SCHEDULE:
- Start Date: January 3, 2025.
- Duration: 17 sessions.
- Academic Hours: 85 hours.
- Schedule: Tuesdays from 17:30 to 21:30, Fridays from 09:00 to 13:00.

LEARNING FORMAT:
- Hybrid learning format.
- Classes will be held on-campus at Bar-Ilan University in Ramat Gan and via Zoom, based on participant preference.

COURSE TOPICS:
- Explain the role and function of network components.
- Describe characteristics of network topology architectures.
- Compare physical interface and cabling types.
- Configure and verify IPv4 addressing and subnetting.
- Configure and verify IPv6 addressing and prefix.
- Describe wireless principles.
- Configure and verify VLANs (normal range) spanning multiple switches.
- Configure and verify interswitch connectivity.
- Configure and verify Layer 2 discovery protocols.
- Configure and verify Layer 2/Layer 3 EtherChannel (LACP).
- Describe AP and WLC management access connections.
- Interpret the components of a routing table.
- Configure and verify IPv4 and IPv6 static routing.
- Configure and verify single area OSPFv2.
- Configure and verify inside source NAT using static and pools.
- Configure and verify NTP operating in a client and server mode.
- Configure and verify DHCP client and relay.
- Configure network devices for remote access using SSH.
- Define key security concepts, including threats, vulnerabilities, exploits, and mitigation techniques.
- Describe security program elements, such as user awareness and physical access control.
- Configure device access control using local passwords.
- Describe security password policy elements.

REGISTRATION AND CONTACT INFORMATION:
- To schedule an admission interview and registration, contact Esther Asulin.
- Phone: 052-5886002.
- Email: esther.asulin@biu.ac.il.

INSTITUTIONAL INFORMATION: The course is offered by the School of High-Tech and Cyber, under the framework of dedicated programs at Bar-Ilan University.
